page.title: 10Morchard Bishop's Churches-2
page.content: The Methodist Church was built in 1845 and has 50 members.The Church belongs to a group of 16 churches called The Ringsash Curcuit.The curcuit has 2 ordained ministers,one of whom lives in the village.There are 2 services every Sunday,one in the morning at 11 and one in the evening at 6.30.These are conducted by the ministers or local preachers.These local preachers are lay men,who have had to undertake a long training programme and an examination.There are 55 local preachers in this curcuit.Holy Communion is celebrated monthly and there are weekly meetings for Bible study and prayer.There is a Sunday School which has 38 pupils,the Girl's Brigade which has 44 girls.The Womens' Fellowship has 15 members and meets monthly.
